intro: Myrciaria cordifolia, commonly known as the Brazilian cherry or cupuaçu, is a species native to the Amazon rainforest. It is a small evergreen tree that can grow up to 10 meters in height, characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and fragrant white flowers. The plant produces edible fruits that are rich in nutrients, including vitamin C and antioxidants. Its botanical features make it an important species for both ecological and agricultural purposes in its native habitat.
